lead_paragraph: Pass a traditional video game controller to someone older than 50, and you are likely to get a look of bewilderment. That’s one reason Nintendo’s Wii controller  modeled after the familiar TV remote  has mass appeal, even in places like retirement homes. As the battle for the living-room screen escalates, there are signs that Sony and Microsoft are seeing the importance of simplified controls as well.

headline.main: Simplify the Controllers, and Everyone’s a Video Gamer
